txt.en: 'The name meant strongest in his tongue.'
'Rather than seeking to force the beast to his will, Eorl simply held out his hand and let it bow its head to touch him.'
'I will avenge you, father.'
'The mearh came to stand before him.'
'There you are....'
'You loved your freedom, and I do not blame you for that.'
Instance: The Taming of the Mearas
'For days Eorl hunted the mearh, bow at the ready. His friends always close behind.'
Eorl's Friend
'It has been days, but I will avenge you.'
'But now you owe me a great weregild, and you shall surrender your freedom to me until your life's end.'
'Eorl, are you going to kill the mearh?!'
'Eorl rode him home without bit or bridle; and he rode him in like fashion ever after.'
'Eorl stood up and called out in a loud voice.'
'The horse heard him, and to the wonder of those who watched, it looked toward him, and seemed to know him.'
'Then Eorl mounted him, and Felaróf submitted.'
'Felaróf I name you.'
'When he got within shooting range, his anger cooled at the sight of the steed's beauty.'
'Please Eorl, let us return home.'
'The Éothéd marvelled at the sight, and spoke of Eorl as being worthy of a crown, but he demurred.'
'Come hither, Mansbane, and get a new name!'
